data.event: The county was established on March 26, 1804, from part of Lycoming County and later organized in 1830.
The county was established on March 26, 1804, from part of Lycoming County and later organized in 1830.
It is home to Punxsutawney Phil, the groundhog that predicts when spring will come every February 2 (Groundhog Day).
Cook Forest State Park is in Barnett Township and stretches into neighboring Clarion and Forest Counties The Jefferson County Fair is held annually in July.
